channel.title: GC is Online
channel.description: Recent content on GC is Online

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.

item.title: 24 Hours for Online Moving
item.description: 2018/2/21 is a Good day! 24 Hours for my new blog website moving from hexo to hugo. It is nice for a long-term rstudio user. Love it!

item.title: Merge two table
item.description: The question is how to merge two tables, it is easy to use merge. However, it is not easy to merge because the two table have different sample sizes and we want to keep all of them. Table 1: Some names not in table 2 name plot1 name_a 1 name_t 2 name_g 3 name_e 4 name_b 5 name_l 6 name_p 7 name_u 8 name_k 9 name_m 10 name_h 11 name_z 12 name_o 13 name_f 14 name_v 15 Table 1: Some names not in table 1 name plot2 name_x 1 name_q 2 name_f 3 name_y 4 name_j 5 name_g 6 name_o 7 name_l 8 name_h 9 name_r 10 Now we have problems, some names exist in table 1 but not in table 2, and vice verse.

item.title: Test rmd plot
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min.

item.title: test a new post
item.description: 假设一个二项分布事件，要求估计出参数theta drive = c('texting','texting','texting','not','not', 'texting','texting','not','not','texting') # convert to numeric, arbitrarily picking texting=1, not=0 driveNum = ifelse(drive=='texting', 1, 0) N = length(drive) # sample size nTexting = sum(drive=='texting') # number of drivers texting nNot = sum(drive=='not') # number of those not 我们武断设置一系列theta作为我们的先验概率，使用Kruschke方法限定先验概率接近0.5 theta = seq(from=1/(N+1), to=N/(N+1), length=10) ### prior distribution # uniform # pTheta = dunif(theta) # triangular as in Kruschke pTheta = pmin(theta, 1-theta) # beta prior with mean = .

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Bayesian for binomial
item.description: 假设一个二项分布事件，要求估计出参数theta drive = c('texting','texting','texting','not','not', 'texting','texting','not','not','texting') # convert to numeric, arbitrarily picking texting=1, not=0 driveNum = ifelse(drive=='texting', 1, 0) N = length(drive) # sample size nTexting = sum(drive=='texting') # number of drivers texting nNot = sum(drive=='not') # number of those not 我们武断设置一系列theta作为我们的先验概率，使用Kruschke方法限定先验概率接近0.5 theta = seq(from=1/(N+1), to=N/(N+1), length=10) ### prior distribution # uniform # pTheta = dunif(theta) # triangular as in Kruschke pTheta = pmin(theta, 1-theta) # beta prior with mean = .
